de.javasoft.swing.jydocking
Interface IDockableAcceptor

public interface IDockableAcceptor

This interface is designed to specify your own rules to allow/accept dragged dockables. DockingPort.isDockingAllowed(java.awt.Component, String) checks IDockable instances by calling acceptDockable(IDockable, String) while dragging child dockables.

Since:
V1.2.0
Version:
1.00, 15.05.2010

Method Summary
 boolean acceptDockable(IDockable dockable, java.lang.String region)
          Returns true if the dragged dockable is allowed to be docked to the target dockable JYDockingView - the owner of the acceptor instance.
 

Method Detail

acceptDockable

boolean acceptDockable(IDockable dockable,
                       java.lang.String region)
Returns true if the dragged dockable is allowed to be docked to the target dockable JYDockingView - the owner of the acceptor instance.

Parameters:
dockable - The dragged dockable.
region - The target region of the target dockable.
Returns:
True to accept and finish drag and drop, false to decline drag and drop.
See Also:
JYDockingView.setDockableAcceptor(IDockableAcceptor), IDockable.setDockableAcceptor(IDockableAcceptor), DockingPort.isDockingAllowed(java.awt.Component, String)
